query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: D1.2 Data management plan (VILNIUS TECH, DMP, PU, M3): A data management plan following the Horizon Europe guidelines will be first released on M3. It will address the relevant aspects of making data FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable), including what data the project will generate, whether and how it will be made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.

project.title: CLIMAte change citizens engagement toolbox for dealing with Societal resilience

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Innovation journey map (final version)
result.description: A practical journey map laying out the implementation steps required to facilitate the innovation process with the active involvement of the forum participants towards the co-creation and pick-up of responsible enabling technologies. The report will consider the specificities of emerging enabling technologies and feedback gathered from evaluation (WP5) to identify changes and/or improvements needed.

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: D3.1 Data collection infrastructure ICT and data base
result.description: D3.1 is linked with Task 3.1:Develop the data collection infrastructure and framework in PV reliability on islands and Task 3.2: Technologies deployment in PV reliability. This deliverable will describe the setting up of the Maltese data collection infrastructure and framework in PV reliability on islands, including open research policies related to and access to the platform. A profile for each test site during the programme is included.

result.title: D3.2 Data collection points (PV sites), technologies and monitoring
result.description: D3.2 is linked with Task 3.3: Research Data Collection and Analysis. This deliverable will create the guide for research-based data collection and analysis including system metadata, location and configuration of the PV installation, PV modules data, monitoring data during operation, and maintenance corrective and preventive operations performed. as well as environmental data irradiance (possibly also spectrally resolved or cloud pictures), airborne particles (PM2.5,10) concentration, wind speed and direction, ambient temperature and modules temperature, electrical yield values or even IV-curves fromdetailed measurement. It will form the basis for a research data management system on the topic.
